intro: Leontodon scariosus, commonly known as the scarious leontodon, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are linear and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a white center. Leontodon scariosus is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
